name: keloid
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a scar that grows bigger and more lumpy than the wound it is healing: Keloids are formed from collagen that the body produces after a wound has healed. Keloid scars may occur up to one year after the original trauma to the skin.
More examplesFewer examplesOccasionally keloid formation gets out of control. She had had a painful keloid on the left arm that resulted from the healing of a laceration.Anyone prone to keloid scarring - permanent, raised scars - should stay away from tattoos.
